intro: Fumaria acrocarpa, commonly known as the upright fumitory, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Fumaria acrocarpa is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
